result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett C. Landru was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jail time that he is currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not have any contact with the victim, Wilmer Mueller.

The defendant may not consume alcohol and no prescence in bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Eligible for huber.

Clerk added credit of 338 days per direction of Judge Rhode via email dated 5/3/19.
Consecutive to: Any jail time that the defendant is currently serving.
The defendant must perform 10 hours of community service per week while on probation unless he is full time employed/school.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of prison wages and or on accounts to be garnished for remaining costs/restitution on this case, until paid in full.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence the defendant is serving.

records.addlTxt: Denied - not in the public interest

02:31 PM Defendant Brett C. Landru in court, in custody from Jackson Correctional.  Alex Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court puts on the record that this matter is being heard via Zoom due to Covid 19 Pandemic, makes sure no parties have any objections to the matter being heard in this manner, matter is also being live streamed via You Tube. Called 15CF139 and 16CF07. Court - here on sentence adjustment, count one on 15CF139 and count 2 on 16CF07. Landru makes statement and argues for sentence adjustment. Seifert - makes statement, applauds Landru for his positive adjustments, programming was denied at time of sentencing believes with intent that he would serve his entire sentence, recites criminal history, victims have been contacted in 15CF139 - no input - just would like notification of outcome, no answer from victim in 16CF07, Marcy's law has been complied with and objects to sentence adjustment. Landru makes final argument and again asks court to grant motion for early release. Court - goes over the factors to consider, commends Landru on his achievements, goes over statue, explains what the court would like to see and denies petition for sentence adjustment.
Hearing on June 4, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
court prefers to have defendant appear by video if possible to save expense of transport
to Produce
Hearing on June 4, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
DA objects to petition for sentence adjustment

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC to court - qualify credit - Per court amend JOC to reflect 338 days credit.
06-29-18 SENTENCING ON REVOCATION TRANSCRIPT
Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:30 PM. Called 15CF139 and 16CF07. All parties have received ROAW. 15CF139 - Count 1 and 16CF07 - Count 2. State indicates correction on page 2 - states no prior revocations however case 16CF130 defendant has been revocated on prior. Dickens agrees. Court takes notice of that inaccuracy on the revocation paperwork. Dickens no further inaccuracies. State recaps criminal history and asks for 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 4 years of extended supervision on each count, ask for sentence to be concurrent to the extended supervision in case 10CF73 that he is currently serving, 248 days credit, also asks for an order by the court to garnish 25% of his prison wages and to be applied to the restitution that is still owed. Dickens makes statement and asks for one year in the WI State Prison System, concurrent to other cases and 3 months of extended supervision on each count. Landru makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts statement of all parties and sentences to the following: Case 15CF139, count 1 and on case 16CF07, count 2: 7 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System 3 years of incarceration with 4 years of extended supervision, concurrent to each other and concurrent to the extended supervision that you have already been sentenced on, credit for 248 days credit, finds not eligible for any programs in the prison system, firearm rights given, orders 25% of prison wages/accounts to be garnished for amounts owed on this case, appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 29, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
with Revocation Summary attached

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. Called 15CF139, 16CF08 and 16CF130. State - resolved - on 15CF139 - dismiss repeater enhancer on count #1 - plead G to amended count #1, counts #2 and #3 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with defense free to argue conditional jail time and state is asking for 1 year; on 16CF07 - #2 - dismiss and remove enhancer (repeater), plead G to count #2 as amended, counts #1 and #3 - DRI, withhold sentenc and place on probation for 3 years with court costs; on 16CF130 - amend count #2 to misd BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - plead to amended count #2 and #1 as alleged, 3 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years; conditions of probation not discussed but take boiuler plate (agreed): AODA and follow thru, no possession of alcohol and no entry, employment/school, restitution to be discussed (have complied with victim notification requirements), no contact with victims, community service - free to argue - State asking for 200 hours total. No discussion on credit if revoked. Dickens - defendant is currently serving a different sentence (270 days served under probation hold - nothing available on these cases). State does have a restitution request from one of the victims (WM) and submits that to the Court - $400.00 plus VW surcharge for a total of $440.00. State provides Court with another restitution report from victim in a separate case. Court has received a letter from the victim on 10/14/16 - Court allows counsel to review the letter it received (9:46 AM). Dickens needs to clarify offer as put on the record, 16CF07 - defendant will be pleading NC otherwise the offer is stated correctly and Dickens and Landru understand and agree with the agreement as recited by State. Court has plea questionnaire. On 15CF139 - Court amends count #1 to delete any repeater/enhancers. Landru pleads G to count #1 as amended. Court - 16CF07 - amends count #2 to delete any enhancer/repeater. Landru pleads G to count #2 as amended. Court - 16CF130 - amends count #2 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a). Landru pleads G to amended count #2 and count #1 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3 on 15CF139; dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #3 on 16CF07, dismisses and reads in count #3 on 16CF130. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - asking for 1 year of conditional jail - consecutive to any sentence that he is currently and also to run all probations consecutive to ES - asks Court to impose restitution of $200.00 on 16CF07 for stated reasons. Dickens makes final argument prior to sentencing - asking for the conditional time to be concurrent if ordered. Landru makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF139 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent with current sentence that he is now serving, with conditions of: 1 year conditional jail - huber allowed - consecutive to any other period of incarceration that he is serving, court costs only (including DNA surcharge), no contact with W.M., AODA and follow thru at discretion of P&P, no consumption of alcohol, no presence in bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 10 hours of community service per week while on probation until/unless full time employed/school, restitution of $400.00 plus VW surchage of $40.00 totalling $440.00 - paid thru probation; 16CF07 - count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent with all other probation and ES, no additional jail time, court costs only (including DNA surcharge); 16CF130 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to any other probation/ES, costs only including DNA surcharge, count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, costs only including DNA surcharge, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, warns of unpaid financial obligations prior to being discharged from probation, right to appeal. Dickens asks if dayy-to-day credit is considered for inpatient treatment. State objects. Court denies, adjourned.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:40 AM. Called 15CF139, 15CM225 and 16CF07. State - 15CM225 is resolved. Dickens - plead to only count as alleged with a $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges. State and Landru agree. Landru pleads NC to count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Dickens - follow joint recommendation. Landru makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA charges, right to appeal. Court will set other two matters for JT on 10/20/16, backing up another JT.  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
State's
Final pre-trial on May 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:05 PM. Also called 16CF07, 16CF08 and 15CM225. State - believes there will be a waiver of PH on 16CF07 and 15CF139 and has filed Information for both of those cases that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of that. Dickens and Landru agree and provides Court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru waiver of PH forms, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial on both cases. Dickens has Information for both of those cases, waives reading of both of those, will proceed to ARGN on both of those cases and enters NG pleas to all counts on those two cases. Court accepts NG pleas on both of those cases. State will proceed with PH on 16CF08 (2:11 PM). State amends count #1 on the complaint prior to proceeding with PH - 940.149(1) - misd battery with repeater component contrary to 939.62(1)(a) and remaining counts to remain as charged. Dickens and Landru have o objections to that amendment. Court amends count #1 on 16CF08 to misd batter as PTAC to 940.149(1) with PTAC contrary to 939.62(1)(a). State offers exhibit #1 - bond form from 15CF139. Court receives after no objections (2:13 PM) and takes judicial notice of it. State calls Robert Munday. Munday sworn in at 2:14 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:16 PM). State offers exhibit #2 - witness statement. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (2:25 PM). Cross edam by Dickens at 2:27 PM. Re-direct by State at 2:33 PM. Munday excused at 2:34 PM. Dickens will stipulate to venue. Court accepts that venue is stipulated to. Dickens calls Joshua Fox. Fox sworn in at 2:35 PM. Direct exam by Dickens. Fox excused at 2:45 PM. Recess at 2:45 PM. Back on record at 2:46 PM. State moves to dismiss charges in 16CF08. Dickens has no objections. Court dismisses 16CF08 entirely. Off record for scheduling. Back on receord at 2:48 PM. Court continues bond on all matters and sets all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
AK
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brett C. Landru in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Brett C. Landru in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:08 PM. Also called 16CF07, 16CF08 and 15CM225. Dickens and defendnat have all complaints, waives reading of all of them, wants PH but Attorney Dickens calendar will not allow for the PH within the time limits and will waive the time limits for that. Courts sets felony cases for PH on 4/5/16 at 2:00 PM and misd. manners will follow as STC, court continues bond on all matters.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-22-2016 01:00 pm
Requesting furlough. Faxed to Judge Rhode.
